transcript.title: PRIME MINISTER'S PROGRAMME FOR JAPAN
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS P. M. No 54/ 1970
PRIME MINISTER'S PROGRAMME FOR JAPAN
The Prime Minister, Mr. John Gorton, will have an audience
with the Emperor and be given a Dinner by the Japanee Prime Minister
when he makes a brief visit to Japan next month for Australia's National
Day ( 8 May) at EXPO.
Mr. Gorton will leave Canberra for Tokyo at 10 o'clock on
the night of Tuesday 5 May, after taking part in that day's sitting of
Parliament. He will make the journey in a BAC 111 aircraft of the
RAAF, returning to Canberra in the early hours of Sunday, 10 May.
Mrs. Gorton will accompany the Prime Minister on the visit,
which is primarily designed to enable Mr. Gorton to be present at the
special day when Australia is the featured country at EXPO
CANBERRA 17 April 1970
NOTE: Programme attached.

PRIME MINISTER'S VISIT TO TOKYO AND OSAKA

Welcoming ceremony.
Imperial Audience ( Prime Minister and Mrs. Gorton).
Prime Minister calls on Primie Minister of Japan.
Dinner given by Prime Minister of Japan in honour
of Prime Minister and Mrs. Gorton.
Depart Tokyo by train for Osaka.
Arrive Osaka.

Prime Minister and Mrs. Gorton.
Official welcome at EXPO for Prime Minister . and
Mrs. Gorton.
Visit Australian pavilion.

Prime Minister and Mrs. Gorton.

at EXPO.
Reception at EXPO given by Prime Minister and
Mrs. Gorton.
Prime Minister and Mrs. Gorton attend " Waltzing
Matilda Revue".
Depart Osaka International Aidrport by RAAF BAG
aircra-ft for Canberra.
